__TOC__

We think testers need to know how partitioning of disks work if they are going to be able to identify problems with it when doing manual testing.

A good place to start is by learning how the physical partitioning, such as Master Boot Record and GPT, work. 

* <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Master_boot_record|MBR]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GUID_Partition_Table|GPT]]</nowiki>

Then, have a look at how those partitions can have transformations applied to them to form new block devices:

* <nowiki>[[https://access.redhat.com/knowledge/docs/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/5/html/Logical_Volume_Manager_Administration/device_mapper.html|device mapper]]</nowiki>
